title: Republicans threaten to filibuster Bidens' nominee for Homeland Security chief
After '7 minutes of terror,' NASA's Perseverance rover will begin an 'epic journey' on Mars next month
description: In 22 days, NASA's Mars 2020 Perseverance rover will land on Mars in Jezero Crater to search for signs of ancient life that may have been on the red planet in the past.

title: Teachers fight return to classrooms without proper safety measures
description: Teachers in Chicago fight for proper coronavirus safety measures as Chicago Public Schools is pushing to have kindergarten through eighth grade students return to classrooms. CNN's Omar Jimenez reports.

title: 'Cut that crap out': Top Republican tells GOP to stop attacking each other over Trump
Biden administration pauses arms sales to Saudi Arabia and UAE, sources say
description: The Biden administration has paused arms sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates as it conducts a wider review of agreements worth billions of dollars made by the Trump administration, sources familiar with the matter told CNN Wednesday.

title: Senator accused of mischaracterizing his military service
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar reports on accusations that Sen. Tom Cotton (R-AR) mischaracterized his military service by claiming he was a ranger when he is only ranger qualified.

title: The GOP's 20 reasons why there shouldn't be impeachment trial
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down 20 of the GOP's arguments against an impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump.

title: 53 dead in West Cameroon bus crash
description: Fifty three people are dead and 29 seriously injured following a collision Wednesday between a bus and a truck containing flammable liquid in West Cameroon.

title: 48-year-old NBA reporter and analyst dies of Covid-19
description: Sekou Smith, NBA reporter and analyst, has died from Covid-19. He was 48.

title: NFL team hires first Black female assistant coach in league history
description: Jennifer King has been hired by the Washington Football Team as a running backs coach, making her the first Black female assistant coach in NFL history.

title: How Trumpism explains the GameStop stock surge
The lunar cycle may be affecting your sleeping patterns, study says
description: Researchers found that people go to bed later and sleep less in the days leading up to a full moon.

title: Two police officers died by suicide after responding to Capitol riot
description: Acting Metropolitan Police Chief Robert J. Contee told the House Appropriations Committee on Tuesday that two police officers have died by suicide since responding to the riot at the Capitol on January 6, according to Contee's opening statement before the committee, which was obtained by CNN.

title: US Covid-19 numbers dip despite hurdles
description: Live updates | Got questions for Biden's pandemic team?

title: Maker of this street-legal car says it topped 300 mph once. But it's not so easy to do it again
description: In October, a small US automaker called SSC North America claimed its 1,750-horsepower Tuatara supercar had gone more than 300 miles an hour, breaking official world speed records for a street legal passenger car.

title: There's a new chill between the White House and the Kremlin
description: Vladimir Putin has tied Washington in knots for years. Now, with the Russian leader facing sudden political pressure at home, the United States is in a position to inflict some pain of its own.

title: Halsey reveals she's pregnant
description: Surprise! Halsey is pregnant.

title: Melania Trump hires staff and establishes post-White House office
description: Former first lady Melania Trump is establishing a post-White House office in Palm Beach, Florida, according to two sources familiar with her plans.

title: War over vaccines between EU and AstraZeneca escalates
EU and AstraZeneca escalate war over vaccines
description:
• LIVE: Variants are impacting tests, FDA says
• UK imposes Australia-style hotel quarantine

title: First look at Kristen Stewart as Princess Diana in 'Spencer'
description: Kristen Stewart certainly resembles Princess Diana.

title: Activist turns old potato chip bags into sleeping bags for the homeless
description: It starts with a pile of used potato chip bags and ends with desperately needed sleeping bags to help Detroit's homeless face the brutal winter.

title: New Zealand tells tourists to stop copying other people's travel photos
description: New Zealand is really bored of your Instagram posts.

title: Yulia Navalnaya's husband was poisoned and detained. Now she is piling pressure on Putin
description: "Why are you detaining me? Have I violated any laws?" demanded Yulia Navalnaya, as four policemen surrounded her on Saturday. She was on her way to a protest in Moscow, where thousands had gathered to demand the release of her husband, Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny, from jail.

title: NASA calls landing the Mars rover '7 minutes of terror'
description: Soon NASA's Perseverance rover will attempt to land on the surface of Mars. Here's why it is crucial for all the steps to go exactly as planned.

title: The teenage twins pushing each other to pro golf success
description: Sibling rivalry at a young age can often be a professional athletes beginning in their sport.

title: Dethroned Italian prince criticized over Holocaust Memorial Day apology
description: A letter from a descendent of Italy's wartime King, apologizing for his ancestor's role in enabling Mussolini's fascist policies during World War II, has been criticized by historians and Jewish groups after several decades of silence from members of the disbanded royal family.

title: Dutch mayor calls anti-curfew protesters 'scum of the earth'
description: Police in the Netherlands arrested more than 400 rioters nationwide this week after a violent backlash to a national, nightly curfew designed to reduce social contact came into effect on January 23. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

title: Newly released reports paint timeline of fire that led to former Zappos CEO's death
description: The investigation into the house fire that led to former Zappos CEO Tony Hsieh's death is now concluded, the New London, Connecticut, Police Department announced Tuesday.

title: Vaccine recipients send message of hope
description: A reason to celebrate at England's Rose Lodge Care Home — today is vaccine day. After a Covid-19 outbreak left half the residents sick and four dead, this first dose has brought new hope for a way out of the deadly pandemic that has killed more than 100,000 in the UK. CNN's Salma Abdelaziz reports.

title: Youth poet laureate Amanda Gorman signs with IMG models
description: Less than a week after enrapturing audiences at President Joe Biden's inauguration ceremony, America's youth poet laureate Amanda Gorman has signed with one of the world's biggest modeling agencies.

title: Russia's youth are using a new tool to take on Putin
description: Supporters of Russia's opposition leader Alexey Navalny gear up for more protests as the nation's youth grow more empowered to speak up against President Vladimir Putin.
